qas.question: When did the Cubs promote assistant general manager and player personnel director Jim Hendry?
What was Jim Hendry promoted to?
Who did the Cubs hire in response to Jim Hendry's promotion?

context: The Cubs had high expectations in 2002, but the squad played poorly. On <a0_0>July 5, 2002<a0_0/> the Cubs promoted assistant general manager and player personnel director Jim Hendry to <a1_0>the General Manager position<a1_0/>. The club responded by hiring <a2_0>Dusty Baker<a2_0/> and by making some major moves in '03. Most notably, they traded with the Pittsburgh Pirates for outfielder Kenny Lofton and third baseman Aramis Ramírez, and rode dominant pitching, led by Kerry Wood and Mark Prior, as the Cubs led the division down the stretch.
